handist.collections.glb

Class GlbFuture<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • handist.collections.glb.GlbFuture<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - type of the distributed collection returned by the operation taking place
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class GlbFuture<R>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    DistFuture represents the progress of an operation that can take place under GLB
    Author:
    Patrick Finnerty
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • after

        public GlbFuture<R> after(GlbFuture<?> dependency)
                   throws OperationNotSupportedException
        Places a dependency on the operation represented by this instance. This operation will not start until the operation passed as parameter has completed globally
        Parameters:
        dependency - the operation that needs to complete for this operation to start
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        OperationNotSupportedException - is still in development

      • getErrors

        public List<Throwable> getErrors()
        Returns the exceptions thrown by the user-provided lambda expression during the computation. If the computation was not previously started, or if it is ongoing, this method will block until the operation terminates and return the exceptions that were thrown during the operation.
        Returns:
        All Throwables thrown during the operation

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Returns the current priority of the underlying GLB operation. The smaller the integer, the higher the priority.

        By default, GLB operations are assigned a priority based on the order in which they were created. Operations created earlier are assigned a higher priority. This order can be changed by manually overriding the priority of an operation with method setPriority(int).

        Returns:
        the current priority level of this operation as an integer

      • result

        public R result()
        Yields back the result of the operation submitted to the GLB which this instance represents.
        Returns:
        distributed collection handle

      • setPriority

        public GlbFuture<R> setPriority(int priority)
        Set the priority level for this operation. The priority is determined through the natural ordering of integers, with a smaller value indicating a higher priority.

        By default, GLB operations are assigned a priority based on the order in which they were created. Operations created earlier are assigned a higher priority. You can override this default value by calling this method with the desired priority value as parameter.

        Note that only the relative difference in priority between operations are used. Setting priority values with larger differences between them does not change the behavior of the schedule, i.e. having three operations (A, B, C) of respective priority (0, 1, 2) or (-10, 0, 42) will result in the same behavior. Also note that it is possible to set multiple operations with the same priority level without any adverse effect. The priority between these operations with identical priority will be decided arbitrarily.

        Be mindful of the fact that the priority of a GLB operation cannot be changed once that operation has started. Calling this method on an operation which is running or which has already completed will throw an IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        priority - the desired priority level (low integer value correspond to higher priority)
        Returns:
        this object, allowing for chained calls to methods of this object
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying operation has already started or has completed

      • waitGlobalTermination

        public void waitGlobalTermination()
        Blocks the progress of the GLB program until the operation represented by this instance has completed on each host.

        Calling this method in a GLB program will cause all previously submitted operations to start.
